title: (x) The Hudson Valley Golf Guide - Oz Handicraft, Times {Marc O, Yves}
content:
I don’t have the source and need to change the “The Hudson Valley’s Golf Guide” image attached (can also be seen at [http://www.hudsonvalleygolf.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20071126054823/http:/www.hudsonvalleygolf.com/ "http://www.hudsonvalleygolf.com") .  
 I think the “Golf Guide” part is “Georgia” . I can’t figure out what font is used for “The Hudson Valley’s” .  
 Any help would be appreciated.  
Thanks,  
Tom OBrien

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [thehudsonvalleysgolfguide.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20071126054823/http:/typophile.com/files/thehudsonvalleysgolfguide.gif) | 8.49 KB |

 [‹ 7 old metal faces](http://web.archive.org/web/20071126054823/http:/www.typophile.com/node/16658 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Christian Dior logo - based on Nicholas Cochin {Mark S} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071126054823/http:/www.typophile.com/node/16790 "Go to next forum topic")
author: tob

comments.content:
Thanks,  
 You’re right. It is oz-handicraft but .................. aparantly I was wrong about the “Golf Guide” part. I thought it was “Georgia” but I can’t quite match up the new text with the old.  
 Let me just say that I’m a photoshop novice so you know my skill level. I’ve tried changing the “vertical and horizontal” scales but the “Georgia” still seems to be different. (more narrow).  
 Any help on the “Golf Guide” font would be appreciate.  
Thanks,  
Tom
Golf Guide is plain old Times.
